history.text: Hello!
Hi! This movie stars Leonardo DiCaprio.
Nice, I love him!  What is the name of the movie?
"The Wolf of Wall Street" is the film's title.
Cool, what kind of reviews does it have?
Honestly, some negatives - it seems that some people did not like how claustrophobically narrow the scope of the film was, or its drug use.
Interesting.  What is the movie about?

It's a black comedy about the stock market being manipulated by Jordan Belfort, a controve
rsial figure from real life.
Oh cool!  I love black comedies.  Who is the director?

Martin Scors
ese directed the film.
Awesome, well he is a legend.
I absolutely agree.
Any other actors or actresses I might recognize?
Jonah Hill has a supporting role. Margot Robbie plays the female lead, and it also features Rob Reiner.
Right on.  I love Jonah Hill, and Margot Robbie is great!  So how does this guy become so powerful on Wall Street?

After losing his job at a brokerage, he starts a boiler room brokerage firm that specializes in easily manipulated penny stocks.  His charisma and ability to influence others leads him to amassing a small fortune through that firm.
Woah, that is pretty impressive.
Where does the drug use come into play?

Jordan (DiCaprio) develops a drug habit as the stress of trying to stay one s
tep ahead of the FBI and SEC start to affect his life.
Okay, that makes sense.  What exactly was he doing that was drawing the attention of the feds?

He made $22 million in three hours by manipulating an IPO for Steve Madden, the shoe designer.  That got the attention of tthe feds, who then saw shady accounting practices at the firm and tried to piece to
gether what was happening.
Woah, that is a bold move.  Did he end up getting caught in the end?

By the rules of this assignment, I can't discuss that yet because it's not
 on the sheet in front of me. Sorry - I guess you'll have to watch it to see!
Now it says it!
Hold on
Yes, he does get caught and serves three years in minimum security.
Wow, that seems like such a weak sentence.
I guess when you're rich you get treated better by the system.
He gave information on some of his former colleagues in exchange for a reduced sentence, as well.
Ah, of course.
I can't believe this is based on a true story.
Would you like to know what he does nowadays?
Yea for sure.
He hosts seminars on sales techniques.
Do you have any other questions?
Wow.  Well at least he isn't breaking the law or ripping people off anymore.
Hopefully he isn't!
Nope, I am definitely intrigued by this movie, thank you very much!
Have a good one!

Thanks for 
the chat!

uid2response.feedback: I didn't have access to the document, but I was able to gather enough information about this movie to want to see it for sure.
